Name: Establishing a pilot program for reserving parking spaces in municipal parking facilities.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a pilot program for reserving parking spaces in municipal parking facilities

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Attachments.Name: March 1, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - March 1, 2017

Summary: The bill would require the Department of Transportation (DOT) to establish a pilot program that would allow carsharing organization to apply for designated parking spaces in municipal parking facilities.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
      
      Section 1. Subdivision a of section 19-175.5 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by a local law for the year 2017 amending the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to establishing a carsharing parking pilot program, is amended by adding a new definition of "municipal parking facility" in alphabetical order to read as follows:
      Municipal parking facility. The term "municipal parking facility" means any city-owned parking facility regulated by the department and operated by the city or by a contractor on behalf of the city that is available for public use. The term "municipal parking facility" does not include any parking facility operated by a city agency intended for use exclusively by such agency's employees or by the public to conduct business with such agency.
      � 2. Section 19-175.5 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by a local law for the year 2017 amending the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to establishing a carsharing parking pilot program, is amended by adding a new subdivision e to read as follows:
      e. As part of the carsharing parking pilot program established pursuant to this section, the department shall allow carsharing organizations to apply for designated parking spaces in municipal parking facilities.
      � 3. This local law takes effect on the same date as a local law amending the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to establishing a carsharing parking pilot program, as proposed in introduction 873-A for the year 2015, takes effect.
 


GZ/LF/KET 2/7/17 6:01PM
Int. No. 135/2010
LS 713/2014

\ul Municipal parking facility. The term "municipal parking facility" means any city-owned parking facility regulated by the department and operated by the city or by a contractor on behalf of the city that is available for public use. The term \ldblquote municipal parking facility\rdblquote  does not include any parking facility operated by a city agency intended for use exclusively by such agency's employees or by the public to conduct business with such agency.\par

Section 19-175.5 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by a local law for the year 2017 amending the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to establishing a carsharing parking pilot program, is amended by adding a new subdivision e to read as follows:\par
\ul e. As part of the carsharing parking pilot program established pursuant to this section, \cf0 the department shall allow carsharing organizations to apply for designated parking spaces in municipal parking facilities\cf1 .\par
\ulnone\'a7 3. This local law takes effect on the same date as a local law amending the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to establishing a carsharing parking pilot program, as proposed in introduction 873-A for the year 2015, takes effect.\par
